oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Top 5 bovine emergencies - solved!
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jones, Meredyth
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: emergency
dystocia
uterine prolapse
bloat
down cow
neonate
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Veterinarians face dynamic and changing situations daily as a matter of routine, but life-threatening emergencies on large animals can really take a toll, especially to the new graduate. Here, we will cover five common emergencies presented to boÂ¬vine veterinarians: bloat, down cow, dystocia, uterine prolapse, and the down neonate.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2022 Recent Graduate Conference Proceedings; 14-17
